critique: The document establishes the National Youth Administration (NYA) to provide relief and employment for youth during the Depression. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is joy, as the NYA aims to alleviate suffering and provide opportunities. There's also an element of hope and reduced fear as the program addresses unemployment. A touch of surprise might be present as a new initiative is launched. Sadness and disgust are less relevant, as the focus is on positive action. The initial scores reflect these considerations. The revised scores are adjusted to better reflect the emphasis on joy and reduced fear.
